title: US-China trade progress is giving global markets some hope
text:
Hong Kong (CNN Business) Asian markets mostly climbed Tuesday, following all-time highs on Wall Street.

Nikkei 225 N225 Hang Seng HSI Japan'sjumped 0.5%, and is trading at its highest level in about a year. Hong Kong'srose 0.5%, too, though pared back its gains and was last trading only slightly positive.

Kospi KOSPI Shanghai Composite SHCOMP South Korea'sadvanced 0.1%. China'swas the region's major outlier. It was trading down 0.3%, accelerating earlier losses.

S&P 500 SPX Dow INDU Nasdaq Composite COMP The mostly positive day in Asia comes after theset a new closing record on Wall Street overnight. Theand thealso closed higher but fell just short of setting a new records.

Hope for an improving US-China trade relationship appears to be driving optimism in the markets. Stocks trended upward last week after the Office of the US Trade Representative said that the world's two largest economies had made headway in finalizing a "phase one" trade agreement.
